security: Disclosing details about the defector's financial arrangement, the use of aliases by Agency personnel, and the devised facility nominee (Roush-Walker Company) could compromise ongoing operations and expose sensitive methods. Quoting directly: 'They signed a classified document acknowledging that the devised facility is an instrumentality of the United States Government. This document was witnessed in alias by Mr. Gmerkin and the undersigned registered strenuous objections to the "mortgage."'
summary: Robert D. Clark documents a meeting in New York City where a defector and his wife mortgaged a property in favor of a CIA-devised facility nominee, Roush-Walker Company, with the transaction and acknowledgement of the facility's CIA link recorded in a classified document.
summary_one_paragraph: On March 2, 1978, Robert D. Clark and Vasia Gmerkin met with a defector and his wife in New York City to finalize a mortgage on their property at 163 East 71st Street in favor of Roush-Walker Company, a CIA-devised facility nominee, for $167,429.88; the defector and his wife signed a classified document acknowledging the CIA's involvement, while Clark recorded his objections to the 'mortgage' arrangement.
title: Meeting in New York: PDLADLE
locations_mentioned: 163 East 71st Street, New York, New York
